title: Bug 108822 - More efficient logic needed for disk sorting when there are boundary values for row value
OB:
When sorting on disk with 40000 rows of data and setting the program to process less than 40000 rows, the current behavior is as follows:
1.
SR:
To reproduce: 
1. Sort the 40000 rows of data on disk.
2. Set the program to process the data with a value less than 40000 rows.
3. Observe the following operations:
   3.1. Save the file as a temporary file.
   3.2. Retrieve the file into memory.
   3.3. Perform the sorting operation.
   3.4. Save the file as a temporary file again.
